Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 46th overall pick, by Wisconsin in 1971...
Traded from Wisconsin to Lynchburg on 2/18/1973 (Going to LYN: LF J. Blizzard, P J. Theis, P W. Venne. Going to WIS: 1B G. Robbins, C E. Chicoine)...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1974, off Andrew Hutto (GHG)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/26/1974, off Bradly Pasley (PON)...
Signed as a free agent by Troy on 2/4/1980 to a 5-year deal worth $5,000,000 per year...
Drove in 8 runs against Penn on 6/3/1981...
Was selected to the 1981 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Gashouse on 5/9/1982...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1982, hitting .455 with 3 HR, 8 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Lynchburg on 6/26/1983...
Hit for the cycle against Syracuse on 7/31/1984...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Syracuse on 7/31/1984...
Signed as a free agent by Boston (FBA) on 2/7/1985 to a 4-year deal worth $4,880,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1985, hitting .450 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1985...
Injured on 8/16/1986 with a Sprained Wrist, out for one week...
Had 2000th career hit on 8/20/1987, off Richard Emert (CC)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Leftfield in 1988...
Signed as a free agent by Columbus on 2/15/1989 to a 1-year deal worth $2,910,000 per year...
